0_1: While U.S.'s population (300M) is 60 times larger than Norway's population (5M), Norway's has won more gold medals(14) than the U.S.(3) in the 2018 Olympic game.
0_2: While having a small population, Norway has won more gold medals than countries with large populations in the 2018 Olympic game.
0_3: Norway has won more gold medals(14) than any other country in the 2018 Olympics Games.
0_4: While China has the highest population-gold medal count ratio, Norway has the lowest.
0_5: There is no positive correlation between population and gold medal count.
1_1: There is a large difference between Norway(1st place) and Germany'(2nd place) total medal counts (39 vs. 31).
1_2: Norway won 39 medals in 2018, while the 2nd place country (Germany) won 31.
1_3: Norway's medal count in 2018 (39) had set a new national record, which was made in 2014 and 1994 with 26 total medals.
1_4: Since 1924, Norway has won 1st place 9 times.
2_1: Since 1924, Norway has been in the top 3 for 18 times.
2_2: After 1992, Norway has been in the top 6 in total medals.
2_3: Since 1924, Norway had only fallen out of the top 6 twice
4_1: 5 out of 10 countries that rank top 10 in total medal also rank top 10 in HDI.
4_2: 17/20 countries that have the top HDI rank also rank among the top 20 in the total medal count.
4_3: Norway's HDI rank remains to be #1 since 2009
